clinical_study.brief_title: Study of PFâ€‘06940434 in Patients With Advanced or Metastatic Solid Tumors.
clinical_study.official_title: A PHASE 1 STUDY TO EVALUATE THE SAFETY, PHARMACOKINETICS, AND PHARMACODYNAMICS OF ESCALATING DOSES OF PF-06940434 IN PATIENTS WITH ADVANCED OR METASTATIC SOLID TUMORS

brief_summary.textblock: Open-label, multi-center, non-randomized, multiple dose, safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetic, and pharmacodynamics and clinical activity study of PF-06940434 in patients with SCCHN (Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck), renal cell carcinoma (RCC - clear cell and papillary), ovarian, gastric, esophageal, esophageal (adeno and squamous), lung squamous cell, pancreatic and biliary duct, endometrial, melanoma and urothelial tumors. This study contains two parts, single agent dose escalation (Part 1A), dose finding of PF 06940434 in combination with anti-PD-1 (Part 1B), biopsy cohorts with monotherapy lead-in at the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) or maximum administered dose (MAD), followed by combination of anti-PD-1 [PF-06801591] (Part 1C) followed by dose expansion (Part 2). Part 2 Dose Combination Expansion will enroll participants into 2 cohorts at doses determined from Part 1B in order to further evaluate the safety of PF-06940434 in combination with anti-PD-1.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with Dose-limiting toxicities (DLT) for Dose Escalation and Dose Finding
Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Change From Baseline in Laboratory Abnormalities
Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) According to Severity
Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) According to Seriousness
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to up to approximately 24 months

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) by Relationship

primary_outcome.description: The period from study entry until disease progression, death or date of last contact.

primary_outcome.measure: Objective Response Rate - Percentage of Participants With Objective Response in Dose Expansion
Duration of Response (DR) for Dose Expansion

secondary_outcome.measure: PF-06940434 after multiple doses PK parameters (Cmax).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose on Cycle 1 Day 1 and on days 3, 8, and 15 of Cycle 1; Day 1 and Day 15 of Cycles 2 and 3; Days 1, 3, 8, and 15 of Cycle 4 and Pre-dose on Day 1 of every cycle thereafter and at end of treatment (each cycle is 28 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum observed plasma concentration of PF-06940434.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve from time zero extrapolated to the last quantifiable dose of PF-06940434.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose on Cycle 1 Day 1 and on days 3, 8, and 15 of Cycle 1; Day 1 and Day 15 of Cycles 2 and 3; Days 1, 3, 8, and 15 of Cycle 4 and Pre-dose on Day 1 of every cycle thereafter and at end of treatment (each cycle is 28 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Time zero extrapolated to the last quantifiable time point prior to the next dose.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose on Cycle 1 Day 1 and on days 3, 8, and 15 of Cycle 1; Day 1 and Day 15 of Cycles 2 and 3; Days 1, 3, 8, and 15 of Cycle 4 and Pre-dose on Day 1 of every cycle thereafter and at end of treatment (each cycle is 28 days)
secondary_outcome.description: CL is a quantitative measure of the rate at which a drug substance is removed from the body.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose on Cycle 1 Day 1 and on days 3, 8, and 15 of Cycle 1; Day 1 and Day 15 of Cycles 2 and 3; Days 1, 3, 8, and 15 of Cycle 4 and Pre-dose on Day 1 of every cycle thereafter and at end of treatment (each cycle is 28 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and titers of neutralizing antibodies (NAb) against PF-06940434.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose on Days 1 and 15 of Cycle 1, pre-dose on Day 1 of Cycles 2 and 3, pre-dose on Day 1 of Cycle 4, pre-dose on Day 1 of every cycle thereafter and at end of treatment (each cycle is 28 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Titers of neutralizing antibodies (NAb) against PF-06940434.

secondary_outcome.measure: PK parameters of PF-06940434 and PF-06801591 (Cmax).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose on Cycle 1 Day 1 and on day 15 of Cycle 1; Day 1 of Cycles 2 and 3; Days 1, 3, 8, and 15 of Cycle 4 and Pre-dose on Day 1 of every cycle thereafter and at end of treatment (each cycle is 28 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum observed plasma concentration after multiple doses of PF-06940434 and PD-1 (PF-06801591).

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve from time zero extrapolated to the last quantifiable dose of PF-06940434 and PF-06801591.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose on Cycle 1 Day 1 and on day 15 of Cycle 1; Day 1 of Cycles 2 and 3; Days 1, 3, 8, and 15 of Cycle 4 and Pre-dose on Day 1 of every cycle thereafter and at end of treatment (each cycle is 28 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the curve from time zero extrapolated to the last quantifiable dose of PF-06940434 and PF-06801591.

secondary_outcome.measure: Characterize the multiple dose PK of PF-06940434 following intravenous administration in combination with PF-06801591.
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum observed plasma concentration of PF-06940434.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve from time zero extrapolated to the last quantifiable dose of PF-06940434.
secondary_outcome.description: Time zero extrapolated to the last quantifiable time point prior to the next dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with increased T-cells after PF-06940434 treatment.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose on Day 1 of Cycle 1; pre-dose on Day 1 of Cycles 2 and 3 (each cycle is 28 days)
Baseline to measured progression (up to approximately 24 months)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Objective Response for Dose Expansion portion

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 8 weeks from the time of enrollment up to 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: DCR is defined as the percent of participants with a confirmed complete response (CR), partial response (PR) or stable disease (SD) according to RECIST 1.1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Trough concentrations of PF-06940434 and PF-06801591 in Dose Expansion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 of Cycle 1 though 4, Day 1 of every 2 Cycles starting from Cycle 5 up to 24 months (each cycle is 28 days)

Pre-dose on Cycle 1 Day 1 and on days 3, 8, and 15 of Cycle 1; Day 1 and Day 15 of Cycles 2 and 3; Days 1, 3, 8, and 15 of Cycle 4 and Pre-dose on Day 1 of every cycle thereafter and at end of treatment (up to 24 Months) [each cycle is 28 days]
secondary_outcome.description: Plasma decay half-life is the time measured for the plasma concentration to decrease by one half.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and titers of anti-drug antibodies (ADA) against PF-06801591 in Dose Finding and Dose Expansion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose on Days 1 and 15 of Cycle 1, pre-dose on Day 1 of Cycles 2 and 3, pre-dose on Day 1 of Cycle 4, pre-dose on Day 1 of every cycle thereafter and at end of treatment (up to 24 Months) [each cycle is 28 days]
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence and titers of anti-drug antibodies (ADA) against PF-06801591.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and titers of neutralizing antibodies (NAb) against PF-06801591 in Dose Finding and Dose Expansion.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose on Days 1 and 15 of Cycle 1, pre-dose on Day 1 of Cycles 2 and 3, pre-dose on Day 1 of Cycle 4, pre-dose on Day 1 of every cycle thereafter and at end of treatment (up to 24 Months) [each cycle is 28 days]
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence and titers of neutralizing antibodies (NAb) against PF-06801591.

clinical_study.condition: Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck

intervention.description: PF-06940434 is given intravenously (IV) every 2 weeks in a 28 day cycle. Multiple dose levels will be evaluated
PF-06801591 will be administered subcutaneously on Day 1 of each 28 day cycle.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histological or cytological diagnosis of SCCHN, RCC (clear cell and papillary cell), ovarian, gastric, esophageal (adeno and squamous), lung squamous cell, pancreatic and biliary duct, endometrial, melanoma, or urothelial cancer.
- Adequate bone marrow, kidney and liver function.
- Performance status of 0 or 1.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participant disease status is suitable for local therapy administered with curative intent.
- Hypertension that cannot be controlled by medications.

facility.name: Washington University School of Medicine Siteman Cancer Center

patient_data.ipd_description: Pfizer will provide access to individual de-identified participant data and related study documents (e.g. protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP), Clinical Study Report (CSR)) upon request from qualified researchers, and subject to certain criteria, conditions, and exceptions. Further details on Pfizer's data sharing criteria and process for requesting access can be found at: https://www.pfizer.com/science/clinical_trials/trial_data_and_results/data_requests.
